breakfast.title: Spicy Indian Chickpea Scramble with Gluten-Free Toast
breakfast.description: A protein-rich scramble made with chickpea flour, Indian spices, and vegetables served with gluten-free toast
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare the batter**: Mix chickpea flour with 120ml water, turmeric, cumin seeds, chili powder, and salt to form a smooth batter
2. **Sauté vegetables**: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a pan, add diced onions and cook for 2-3 minutes
3. **Add tomatoes**: Add diced tomatoes and cook for another 2 minutes until soft
4. **Cook scramble**: Pour the chickpea batter into the pan and scramble like eggs for 5-6 minutes until cooked through
5. **Toast bread**: Toast gluten-free bread and brush with remaining olive oil
6. **Garnish and serve**: Top scramble with fresh coriander and serve with toast

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable and Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: A colorful bowl of grilled Mediterranean vegetables over quinoa with tahini dressing
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in 200ml water for 15 minutes until fluffy
2. **Prepare vegetables**: Cut zucchini, bell peppers, and eggplant into thick slices
3. **Season vegetables**: Brush vegetables with 2 tbsp olive oil, oregano, paprika, and salt
4. **Grill vegetables**: Grill vegetables on medium-high heat for 4-5 minutes each side until tender and charred
5. **Make dressing**: Whisk tahini with lemon juice, minced garlic, remaining olive oil, and 2 tbsp water
6. **Assemble bowl**: Place quinoa in bowl, top with grilled vegetables and chickpeas
7. **Finish and serve**: Drizzle with tahini dressing and garnish with fresh parsley

dinner.title: Spicy Thai-Italian Fusion Pasta with Vegetables
dinner.description: Gluten-free pasta tossed with Thai-inspired spicy tomato sauce and grilled vegetables
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook pasta**: Boil gluten-free pasta according to package directions until al dente
2. **Prepare tofu**: Cut tofu into cubes and pan-fry in 1 tbsp olive oil until golden
3. **Grill vegetables**: Grill bell pepper and broccoli until tender and slightly charred
4. **Make sauce**: Heat remaining oil, sauté minced garlic for 1 minute
5. **Add spice**: Add Thai curry paste and chili flakes, cook for 30 seconds
6. **Build sauce**: Add crushed tomatoes, coconut milk, and soy sauce, simmer for 10 minutes
7. **Combine**: Toss pasta with sauce, grilled vegetables, and tofu
8. **Finish**: Garnish with fresh basil and grated parmesan cheese

breakfast.title: Spiced Indian Chickpea Flour Pancakes (Besan Chilla)
breakfast.description: Protein-rich savory pancakes with Indian spices and vegetables
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare the batter**: Mix chickpea flour with water to form a smooth batter. Let it rest for 5 minutes.

2. **Add vegetables**: Finely chop onion, tomato, and green chili. Add to the batter along with turmeric, cumin powder, red chili powder, coriander, and salt.

3. **Cook pancakes**: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a non-stick pan. Pour half the batter and spread evenly. Cook for 3-4 minutes until golden, flip and cook 2 minutes more. Repeat for second pancake.

4. **Serve**: Serve hot with toasted gluten-free bread on the side.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable and Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: Colorful grilled vegetables with quinoa, feta, and Mediterranean herbs
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in 240ml water for 15 minutes until fluffy. Set aside.

2. **Prepare vegetables**: Cut zucchini, bell peppers, and eggplant into thick strips. Halve cherry tomatoes.

3. **Make marinade**: Mix olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.

4. **Grill vegetables**: Toss vegetables in half the marinade. Grill on medium-high heat for 8-10 minutes, turning once.

5. **Assemble bowl**: Layer quinoa in bowl, top with grilled vegetables, crumbled feta, fresh basil, and remaining marinade.

dinner.title: Thai-Style Spicy Tofu and Rice Noodle Stir-Fry
dinner.description: Aromatic Thai-inspired dish with crispy tofu, rice noodles, and spicy sauce
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare noodles**: Soak rice noodles in hot water according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.

2. **Prepare tofu**: Cut tofu into cubes, pat dry, and pan-fry in 2 tbsp oil until golden and crispy. Set aside.

3. **Make sauce**: Mix soy sauce, lime juice, brown sugar, and sesame oil in a small bowl.

4. **Stir-fry vegetables**: Heat remaining oil in wok. Add minced garlic, ginger, and chili. Stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add broccoli and carrots, cook for 3-4 minutes.

5. **Combine**: Add noodles, tofu, bean sprouts, and sauce to the wok. Toss everything together for 2-3 minutes until heated through.

6. **Serve**: Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with lime wedges.

breakfast.title: Spiced Indian Quinoa Porridge with Greek Yogurt
breakfast.description: A warming, protein-rich breakfast with aromatic Indian spices, quinoa, and creamy Greek yogurt
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Rinse quinoa** thoroughly under cold water until water runs clear
2. **Cook quinoa** in 150ml water with a pinch of salt for 15 minutes until tender
3. **Add spices** - stir in cinnamon, cardamom, and turmeric to the cooked quinoa
4. **Heat coconut milk** gently and pour over spiced quinoa
5. **Slice banana** and fold into the mixture
6. **Serve** topped with Greek yogurt, drizzled honey, and sprinkled chia seeds
7. **Enjoy** while warm for best flavor

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable and Chickpea Power Bowl
lunch.description: A vibrant, protein-packed bowl with grilled Mediterranean vegetables, chickpeas, and tahini dressing
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa** in salted water for 15 minutes until fluffy, then set aside
2. **Prepare vegetables** - slice zucchini, bell pepper, and eggplant into strips
3. **Season vegetables** with 1 tbsp olive oil, paprika, cumin, salt and pepper
4. **Grill vegetables** on medium-high heat for 3-4 minutes per side until charred and tender
5. **Drain and rinse chickpeas**, then sauté with minced garlic for 5 minutes
6. **Make tahini dressing** by whisking tahini, lemon juice, remaining olive oil, and 2 tbsp water
7. **Assemble bowl** with quinoa base, grilled vegetables, and chickpeas
8. **Garnish** with cherry tomatoes, fresh parsley, and drizzle with tahini dressing

dinner.title: Thai-Spiced Grilled Tofu with Italian Herb Quinoa Risotto
dinner.description: A fusion dish combining Thai-inspired grilled tofu with creamy Italian-style quinoa risotto
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Press tofu** for 15 minutes to remove excess water, then cut into thick slices
2. **Marinate tofu** in mixture of red curry paste, soy sauce, and lime juice for 10 minutes
3. **Heat vegetable broth** in a saucepan and keep warm
4. **Sauté onion and garlic** in 1 tbsp olive oil until fragrant
5. **Add quinoa** to pan and toast for 2 minutes, stirring constantly
6. **Add warm broth gradually** (like risotto), stirring frequently for 20 minutes until creamy
7. **Meanwhile, grill marinated tofu** on medium-high heat for 4-5 minutes per side until golden
8. **Stir coconut milk, nutritional yeast, and herbs** into quinoa risotto
9. **Add cherry tomatoes and chili flakes** in final 2 minutes of cooking
10. **Serve risotto** topped with grilled Thai-spiced tofu and fresh basil leaves

breakfast.title: Spicy Mediterranean Chickpea Scramble Bowl
breakfast.description: A protein-packed vegetarian scramble with chickpea flour, Mediterranean spices, and vegetables served over gluten-free toast
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare the batter**: Mix chickpea flour with water, turmeric, salt, and nutritional yeast until smooth
2. **Heat oil**: In a non-stick pan, heat 1 tbsp olive oil over medium heat
3. **Cook vegetables**: Add bell pepper and cook for 2 minutes, then add tomatoes and spinach
4. **Add scramble**: Pour chickpea mixture into pan and scramble like eggs for 3-4 minutes
5. **Season**: Add chili flakes and oregano, mix well
6. **Toast bread**: Toast gluten-free bread and drizzle with remaining olive oil
7. **Serve**: Place scramble over toast and enjoy hot

lunch.title: Thai-Spiced Grilled Vegetable and Quinoa Power Bowl
lunch.description: A vibrant bowl with grilled vegetables, quinoa, and Thai-inspired spicy peanut-free sauce
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse and cook quinoa in 200ml water until fluffy (15 minutes)
2. **Prepare tofu**: Press tofu and cut into cubes, marinate in 2 tbsp soy sauce
3. **Prep vegetables**: Cut zucchini, eggplant, and bell pepper into thick strips
4. **Make sauce**: Mix remaining soy sauce, lime juice, sriracha, coconut milk, minced garlic and ginger
5. **Grill tofu**: Heat 1 tbsp coconut oil and grill tofu until golden (6 minutes)
6. **Grill vegetables**: In same pan, grill vegetables until tender and slightly charred (8 minutes)
7. **Assemble**: Serve quinoa topped with grilled tofu and vegetables
8. **Finish**: Drizzle with spicy sauce, garnish with cilantro and sesame seeds

dinner.title: Indian-Spiced Grilled Paneer with Mediterranean Rice Pilaf
dinner.description: Aromatic grilled paneer with Indian spices served alongside a Mediterranean-style rice pilaf with vegetables
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Marinate paneer**: Cut paneer into cubes and marinate with yogurt, garam masala, cumin, and lemon juice for 20 minutes
2. **Prepare rice**: Rinse basmati rice and soak for 10 minutes
3. **Start pilaf**: Heat 2 tbsp olive oil, sauté diced onion until golden
4. **Add rice**: Add rice to onions, stir for 2 minutes, then add hot broth
5. **Cook rice**: Cover and simmer for 15 minutes until rice is tender
6. **Prep vegetables**: Cut bell peppers and tomatoes into chunks
7. **Grill paneer**: Thread paneer and vegetables on skewers, grill for 10 minutes turning occasionally
8. **Season**: Sprinkle with coriander powder, paprika, and cayenne while grilling
9. **Finish rice**: Stir fresh mint into cooked rice pilaf
10. **Serve**: Plate rice pilaf topped with grilled paneer skewers, drizzle with remaining olive oil

breakfast.title: Spicy Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl with Grilled Vegetables
breakfast.description: A protein-packed gluten-free breakfast bowl with quinoa, grilled vegetables, and spicy Mediterranean flavors
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in vegetable broth according to package directions (about 15 minutes)
2. **Prep vegetables**: Slice zucchini and bell pepper, halve cherry tomatoes
3. **Grill vegetables**: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill vegetables for 8-10 minutes until tender and slightly charred
4. **Season**: Sprinkle vegetables with red pepper flakes, oregano, and garlic powder
5. **Assemble**: Place cooked quinoa in bowl, top with grilled vegetables and crumbled feta
6. **Finish**: Drizzle with remaining olive oil and lemon juice before serving

lunch.title: Thai-Spiced Chickpea and Sweet Potato Curry
lunch.description: A flavorful gluten-free Thai curry with protein-rich chickpeas and sweet potatoes over jasmine rice
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook rice**: Prepare jasmine rice according to package directions
2. **Prep ingredients**: Dice sweet potatoes, onion, mince garlic and ginger
3. **Sauté base**: Heat coconut oil in large pan, sauté onion until soft (5 minutes)
4. **Add aromatics**: Add garlic, ginger, and curry paste, cook 1 minute
5. **Add vegetables**: Add sweet potatoes and chickpeas, stir to coat
6. **Simmer**: Pour in coconut milk, bring to boil, then simmer 15 minutes until potatoes are tender
7. **Season**: Add soy sauce and lime juice, adjust spice level
8. **Serve**: Serve over rice, garnish with fresh Thai basil

dinner.title: Grilled Eggplant Parmigiana with Italian Herbs
dinner.description: A hearty gluten-free Italian classic with grilled eggplant, rich tomato sauce, and melted mozzarella
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prep eggplant**: Slice eggplant into 1/2-inch rounds, salt and let drain 20 minutes
2. **Cook pasta**: Prepare gluten-free pasta according to package directions
3. **Grill eggplant**: Pat eggplant dry, brush with olive oil, grill 4-5 minutes per side
4. **Make sauce**: Sauté minced garlic in remaining oil, add marinara, oregano, and red pepper flakes
5. **Layer dish**: In baking dish, layer grilled eggplant, ricotta, sauce, mozzarella
6. **Bake**: Preheat oven to 375°F, bake 25 minutes until cheese is bubbly
7. **Rest**: Let cool 5 minutes, top with parmesan and fresh basil
8. **Serve**: Serve alongside the cooked pasta

breakfast.title: Spiced Indian Chickpea Flour Pancakes with Greek Yogurt
breakfast.description: Savory gluten-free besan (chickpea flour) pancakes with Indian spices, served with protein-rich Greek yogurt and honey
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Make batter**: In a bowl, whisk together chickpea flour, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, and ginger-garlic paste
2. **Add liquid**: Gradually add water while whisking to form a smooth batter. Let rest for 10 minutes
3. **Cook pancakes**: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a non-stick pan. Pour batter to make 3 medium pancakes. Cook 3-4 minutes each side until golden
4. **Prepare yogurt**: Mix Greek yogurt with honey and chopped cilantro
5. **Serve**: Plate pancakes with yogurt mixture, drizzle remaining olive oil, and garnish with cilantro

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable and Quinoa Power Bowl
lunch.description: Grilled Mediterranean vegetables with protein-packed quinoa, feta cheese, and spicy harissa-tahini dressing
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in 200ml water for 15 minutes until fluffy. Set aside
2. **Prep vegetables**: Cut zucchini, peppers, and eggplant into thick slices. Brush with 2 tbsp olive oil and season with oregano
3. **Grill vegetables**: Grill vegetables on medium-high heat for 4-5 minutes each side until charred and tender
4. **Make dressing**: Whisk together tahini, harissa, lemon juice, minced garlic, and remaining olive oil
5. **Assemble bowl**: Layer quinoa, grilled vegetables, drained chickpeas, and crumbled feta
6. **Finish**: Drizzle with spicy tahini dressing and serve warm

dinner.title: Thai-Inspired Spicy Coconut Curry with Tofu and Rice
dinner.description: Aromatic Thai-style red curry with crispy tofu, vegetables, and jasmine rice - rich, spicy, and satisfying
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook rice**: Rinse jasmine rice and cook in 200ml water for 18-20 minutes until tender
2. **Prepare tofu**: Cut tofu into cubes, pat dry, and fry in 1 tbsp coconut oil until golden and crispy. Set aside
3. **Make curry base**: Heat remaining oil, fry curry paste for 2 minutes until fragrant
4. **Add coconut milk**: Pour in coconut milk, bring to simmer, add palm sugar and soy sauce
5. **Add vegetables**: Add baby corn, snap peas, and bell pepper. Simmer 8-10 minutes until tender
6. **Finish curry**: Add crispy tofu, Thai basil, sliced chilies, and lime juice. Simmer 2 minutes
7. **Serve**: Plate rice and top with curry, garnish with extra Thai basil

breakfast.title: Spiced Chickpea Flour Pancakes with Greek Yogurt
breakfast.description: Savory Indian-inspired besan pancakes with aromatic spices, served with protein-rich Greek yogurt and fresh herbs
breakfast.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Prepare the batter**: In a bowl, whisk chickpea flour with water, turmeric, cumin seeds, chili powder, and salt until smooth. Let rest for 5 minutes.

2. **Heat the pan**: Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and brush with olive oil.

3. **Cook pancakes**: Pour batter to make 2 medium pancakes. Cook for 2-3 minutes until golden, flip and cook for another 2 minutes.

4. **Prepare yogurt**: Mix Greek yogurt with honey and chopped cilantro.

5. **Serve**: Stack pancakes and serve with spiced yogurt on the side.

lunch.title: Mediterranean Grilled Vegetable and Quinoa Bowl
lunch.description: Colorful grilled vegetables over fluffy quinoa with tahini dressing, featuring Mediterranean herbs and spices
lunch.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Cook quinoa**: Rinse quinoa and cook in 200ml water for 15 minutes until fluffy. Set aside.

2. **Prepare vegetables**: Cut zucchini, bell pepper, and eggplant into thick slices. Brush with olive oil and season with oregano, paprika, and salt.

3. **Grill vegetables**: Heat grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill vegetables for 3-4 minutes per side until tender and charred.

4. **Make dressing**: Whisk tahini with lemon juice, garlic powder, and 2 tbsp water until smooth.

5. **Assemble bowl**: Serve quinoa topped with grilled vegetables, crumbled feta, and tahini dressing.

dinner.title: Thai-Spiced Grilled Tofu with Italian Herb Rice
dinner.description: Fusion dish combining Thai aromatics with Italian herbs, featuring grilled tofu steaks over fragrant herb-infused rice
dinner.instructions:
## Instructions

1. **Marinate tofu**: Press tofu and cut into thick steaks. Marinate in soy sauce, curry paste, and lime juice for 15 minutes.

2. **Cook rice**: Cook jasmine rice with coconut milk and water (1:1 ratio) for 18 minutes. Stir in minced garlic, oregano, and basil in the last 5 minutes.

3. **Grill tofu**: Heat olive oil in grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill tofu steaks for 4-5 minutes per side until golden and crispy.

4. **Prepare tomatoes**: Quickly sauté cherry tomatoes with chili flakes for 2 minutes.

5. **Plate and serve**: Serve herb rice topped with grilled tofu, sautéed tomatoes, and grated parmesan. Garnish with fresh basil.
